title: Arnold Schwarzenegger and Linda Hamilton reunite with a friendly kiss
text:
The reunion we all waited for (Picture: David Fisher/REX)

Arnold Schwarzenegger and Linda Hamilton reunited for Terminator: Dark Fate 28 years after Judgement Day and sealed the occasion with a wholesome kiss.

The pair attended the movie’s photocall at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel in London and looked over the moon to be back together after such a long time.

The 63-year-old actress, who left Los Angeles a few years ago, admitted it took a lot for her to come out of acting retirement to reprise her role as Sarah Connor.

‘It wasn’t the script but just the thought of returning to this whole, big thing again after living such a quiet, normal life for so long,’ she told The Sunday Post.

‘Then there is the thought of being compared to yourself as you were back then. That’s not easy for anyone but in the end, I knew I had to do it.’

The new, modified liquid metal Terminator (Gabriel Luna) is sent from the future by Skynet as well in order to terminate Dani Ramos (Natalia Reyes), a hybrid cyborg human (Mackenzie Davis), and her friends.

Sarah Connor comes to their aid, as well as the original Terminator (Arnold) for a fight for the future.

It took Linda a while before she agreed to the role (Picture: David Fisher/REX)

From L to R: Natalia, Linda, Arnold, Mackenzie and Gabriel (Picture: Dave J Hogan/Getty Images)

He did say he’ll be back.

We couldn’t contain our excitement when Linda and Arnold, 72, shared a friendly kiss during the photocall.

They were joined by co-stars Natalia, Gabriela, Mackenzie and Diego Boneta.

Linda might have been worried about being compared to her younger self, but the amount of training she did proves she’s even better now.

She said: ‘I did military training, stunt training, scuba lessons, Spanish lessons.

‘It was extremely hard. At one point I was in the desert in Texas sobbing because it was so hard to be fluid with those weapons.

The two attended the photo call in London (Picture: David Fisher/REX)

‘They loaded me up with 35lbs of weapons and I said, “Forget firing the weapons, I can’t even get out of the car!”

‘There were days when I felt like it was almost physically impossible to keep going but we did it.’

Terminator: Dark Fate is released in cinemas on 25 October in the UK.
